thread.title: Tegna blacks out Dish, including KUSA-Channel 9
thread.title_full: Tegna blacks out Dish, including KUSA-Channel 9 - The Denver Post

author: denverpost
title: Tegna blacks out Dish, including KUSA-Channel 9
text:
Tegna (formerly Gannett) has blacked out Dish viewers' access to its local channels in 38 markets.
In Denver, the blackout affects KUSA-Channel 9, the local NBC affiliate and its sister station, KTVD-Channel 20.
Colorado-based Dish and Tegna have been battling over carriage fees, and have previously extended negotiation deadlines.
At issue: satellite giant Dish won't pay the rate hike sought by Tegna for retransmission consent fees; broadcaster Tegna says all other providers have agreed to the new fees.
Stations run by Tribune Media and Media General are also affected on Dish, DirecTV and U-Verse
In a statement, Dish said "the media conglomerate has used the move to gain deal leverage as it seeks above-market rate increases double the current DISH rate ...
"With DISH willing to grant an extension and a retroactive true up on rates, TEGNA had nothing to lose and consumers had everything to gain by leaving the channels up," said Warren Schlichting, Dish senior vice president of programming. "Instead, TEGNA chose to turn its back on its public interest obligations and use innocent consumers as bargaining chips."
Tegna, for its part, said:
"TEGNA has worked hard over the course of months to reach a deal with DISH. Our position has been simple: the same fundamental terms that allowed us to reach deals with distributors nationwide should serve as the basis for our deal with DISH. Rather than accepting that fair, market-based approach, DISH has refused to reach an agreement and once again is preventing its customers from accessing valued channels, even as customers continue to pay for that content."
